result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin B. Kohel

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Justin B. Kohel appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Justin B. Kohel.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Severson states that there is no resolution at this time; states that he is needing Discovery yet from the DA's office.  

BY THE COURT:  set motion hearing
Atty Severson to file the motion as soon as possible.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:07 PM Defendant Justin B. Kohel appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Justin B. Kohel.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Severson is working on discovery; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State has filed the Information.  Atty Severson received the Information and waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Severson enters Not Guilty plea on all charges.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin B. Kohel in court.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Justin B. Kohel. 
Atty Severson states defendant will waive preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver of preliminary hearing is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *Appear for booking to the Marquette County Jail   *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin B. Kohel in court.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Justin B. Kohel. 
Atty Severson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions
Atty Severson has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking to the Marquette County Jail 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 


Atty Severson states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
